ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.2_0: At that time Venerable Udāyī was staying in the wilderness.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.3_0: He had a beautiful dwelling with a room in the middle and corridors on all sides.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.4_0: The bed and bench were nicely made up,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.5_0: and the water for drinking and the water for washing had been well placed.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.7_0: Many people came to see Udāyī’s dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.8_0: Among them was a certain brahmin and his wife. They approached Udāyī
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.9_0: “Venerable, we would like to have look at your dwelling.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.11_0: having taken a bolt opened a door, he entered the dwelling,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.13_0: And the brahmin male also entered that brahmin.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.14_0: Opening some windows and closing others, Udāyī walked around the inner room and came up from behind the brahmin lady, touching her all over.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.15_0: Then the brahmin thanked Udāyī and left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.16_0: The brahmin then expressed his delight,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.17_0: “These Sakyan ascetics who live in the wilderness are superb.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.20_0: “How could he possibly have succession of success?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.21_0: Just as you touch me all over, so did he.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.22_0: The brahmin then complained and criticized him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.23_0: “These Sakyan ascetics are shameless and immoral liars.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.24_0: Sure, they claim to be of principled and moral conduct, to be celibate, truthful, ethical, and of good character.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.25_0: But they don’t have the qualities of an ascetic or a brahmin.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.27_0: How can the ascetic Udāyī relish me in my calves?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.28_0: It’s not possible to go to a monastery or a monk’s dwelling with wives of respectable families, with daughters, girls, daughters-in-law, or female slaves of respectable families.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.29_0: If women and girls of families, the daughters of good families, the daughters often might go to a monastery or a monk’s dwelling, saying, “Go to the Sakyan ascetics.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.1_0: The monk heard the complaints of that brahmin,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.2_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.3_0: “How can Venerable Udāyī make physical contact with a woman?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.5_0: The Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.6_0: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you made physical contact with a woman?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.9_0: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.10_0: How can you make physical contact with a woman?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.11_0: Haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.12_0: for the stilling of the fevers of sense desire?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.13_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.14_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.15.1_0: ‘If a monk, overcome by lust and with a distorted mind, makes physical contact with a woman—holding her hand or hair, or touching any part of her body—he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.6_0: having lust, longing for, in love with.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.11_0: But in this case “distorted” refers to the desiring mind.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.13_0: a human female, not a female spirit, not a male ghost, not a female animal. On the contrary, even just the threwer.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.21_0: just the hair; or hair with strings in it, with a garland, with gold coins, with gold, with pearls, or with gems.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.23_0: anything apart from the hand and the hair is called “any part of her body”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.1_0: Physical contact, touching, stroking downwards, stroking upwards, pulling down, raising up, pulling, pushing, squeezing, pressing, taking hold of, contacting.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.19_0: taking hold of a bodily part and then pressing.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.26_0: He commits an offense entailing suspension:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.27_0: ... Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.1_0: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.2_0: If she makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if she touches her body, strokes him downwards, strokes him upwards, pulls him down, raises him up, pulls him, pushes him, squeezes him, presses him, takes hold of him, contacts him, and he, aiming at association, makes an effort, and semen is emitted, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.3_0: It is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he has lust.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.4_0: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.5_0: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.6_0: It is a woman, but he perceives her as a _paṇḍaka_, and he has lust.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.7_0: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.8_0: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.9_0: It is a woman, he perceives her as a man, and he has lust.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.10_0: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.11_0: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.12_0: It is a woman, he perceives her as an animal, and he has lust.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.13_0: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.14_0: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.15_0: It is a _paṇḍaka_, he perceives him as a _paṇḍaka_, and he has lust.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.16_0: If the monk makes physical contact with the _paṇḍaka_, body to body, if he touches him ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.17_0: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.18_0: It is a _paṇḍaka_, but he is unsure of it, and he has lust.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.19_0: If the monk makes physical contact with the _paṇḍaka_, body to body, if he touches him ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.20_0: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.21_0: It is a _paṇḍaka_, he perceives him as a man, and he has lust.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.49_0: The section on one root item is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.2.1_0: It is two women, he perceives them both as women, and he has lust.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.2.3_0: takes hold of them, contacts them, he commits two offenses entailing suspension.
